JobFullDesc:
AssociateWe offer: 
 
- To work with some of the best professionals in the business - for a firm that values individual intellect as much as teamwork
- State-of-the-art offices that are designed to maximize collaboration
- Flexible working arrangements 
- Enriching challenges that provide opportunity for constant learning and advancement
- An environment which is leveraging technology to its highest potential 
 

Team Profile: 
 
Institutional Securities Technology (IST) develops and oversees the overall technology strategy and bespoke technology solutions to drive and enable the institutional businesses and enterprise-wide functions. Our clients include Fixed Income, Equities, Commodities, Investment Banking, Research and Global Capital Markets. 
 

Position Description:
 
The ITARA MAPS team in Institutional Securities Technology (IST) division has an excellent opportunity for an experienced Front End Developer to join our development team in Montreal.
 
The successful candidate will have a solid background in UI development using JavaScript/Angular, excellent communication skills and be motivated to work in a fast paced environment where time to market is paramount.
 
You will work closely with end-users in Sales & Trading, Operations, Risk & Compliance etc. to design and implement our next generation of user friendly, web based interfaces on a suite of applications that cater to Metadata management, Trade Data Quality infrastructure and Trade reporting activities. This is a growing and important area of focus for the Firm. The team size in Montreal location has a head count of 12 and over 50 members globally.
 
You should have at least 3 years of overall Web UI development experience using Typescript / JavaScript, preferably on the Angular framework. Experience on working in a full stack environment using Java/Python based web service frameworks will be a huge plus. You should be comfortable with 3 tier architecture systems and be capable of employing a broad array of technical skills and eagerness to learn and grow both technical and financial domain knowledge.
